Key Match Events: Brooklyn Nets defeated Memphis Grizzlies 106-104 in a tightly contested game.
Ja Morant scored a difficult lay-in over Jalen Wilson in the first quarter.
Zach Edey posted six points and five rebounds in the first half.
Edey scored 13 points on a perfect 5-for-5 from the floor in the third quarter.
Dorian Finney-Smith connected on all three of his attempts from deep in the third quarter.
Finney-Smith continued his hot shooting into the fourth quarter, delivering two more three-pointers.
Finney-Smith rattled in a three-pointer to take a 104-101 lead with 60 seconds to play.
Dennis Schröder scored an easy layup to push Brooklyn's lead to five.
Jaren Jackson Jr. banked in a circus three-pointer to bring the Grizzlies within two.
Santi Aldama missed a potential game-winning shot with four seconds to play.
